_keAbNTGWXAkTlVEW6mPuA.text: Love love love! Yummy coffee and pastries. The decor of this place is too cute and love all the nooks to hang out in.

vm4COS1VZbgOdqUAy6z4Vw.text: Surprised!  This place has a great variety and is a breath of fresh air to be something different from the ordinary coffee and pastry shop.  Finally something to look forward to in the morning.  Tried the turkey and bacon sandwich, the ham, egg, and gruyere sandwich, the salted carmel mocha, chai creme, and some of the pastries.  Nothing missed the mark.

QYYj0qumKTo8weBVR4DOmg.text: I'm not typically the 'hit the hip/trendy spot' kind of guy anymore.  But Amelie's new location uptown is just a great location.  Amble seating, and quick friendly service, Uptown Charlotte has needed a location like this for a casual afternoon sit-down coffee spot for a while and this place fits the bill perfectly.

pewoi0XYvEHzDrO0xladKw.text: Heat atmosphere and friendly staff. Food was good and they have a wide selection of desserts that taste great.  Place has long hours as well which make for late night snacking a real possibility when visiting the city.

WZ4We9ebIvNnWHh3r5Uqzw.text: Amelie's Is a pretty good boulangerie as the French say...pretty decent food selections such as the croque monsieur which is pretty solid, its also a massive place with the French vibe thing going on...service can be better though, its disappointing at times and makes me want to take off another star but the food quality makes up for it.

250dQkiokKK5gEkVq0Al4Q.text: What a fantastic find!! This place is huge and the decoration is so Alice in wonderland. I love it! The desserts are great too. Love the homemade sodas.

9Ssa3Hv30DVUYodBGn1mVA.text: Great place for a soup and sandwich lunch.  Or a beer and sandwich dinner, since it's open til 11 (yay).  It has a bar for your convenience, but the best are all the separated tables and alcoves.  Oh, and their croissants are SO flaky, om nom nom. The soup was decent as well.  So if you need a place to work on your laptop while you have lunch, or you're having a quiet get together, this is a darn good spot.

MDPns3WcV1ul42MrKU5AGQ.text: The icing on the petite cakes was complete garbage. Very dry and distasteful. Do not recommend. Ruined my night!!!!

Vtf9K01PV1etehYYtSwSMQ.text: This place gets an average review from me for a very simple reason....Lack of condiment selection.  I get its a "French Style" bakery....but come on your in America.  They do not offer regular mustard?  To me that's just absurd.  Buy a bottle and leave it behind the counter for the once a month that a customer like me comes in and cant stand to eat that fancy grey poupon crap mustard that you have.  Other then that the place is cool....most people in the place were working away on their laptops not buying anything....Then you have me that spends $30.00 on food and cant even get regular mustard....no hot sauce....no steak sauce...no worcestershire sauce.....no nothing that I eat.

Zr5YjM1QuvIKr5XNslxMeQ.text: Great place to visit in Charlotte for a cup of coffee, tea or adult beverage with a little treat on the side. Food is yummy and the service and people are friendly.

4jaWIAAKwYBZlzmzvIVHiw.text: I'm giving this location a two star because the few times I've been there (morning, night, late night, afternoon) I've always gotten mediocre drinks/food. If you've been to the NODA location you expect pricey baked goods and tiny cups of coffee for the same price as a normal human-sized cups of coffee; you expect that. What you don't expect is burned- tasting coffee, hard macaroons, and food that barely deserves the name. I know they have trained staff properly but it sure does not show up in the product.   The staff are normal Amelie's staff; the cashiers are bored, baristas are harried/ rude, bakery counter is goofing around but they're not the issue here. The issue is that every single time I've gone in, the TIMES OF OPERATION are totally different. Whether it's because they've just opened or it's the weekend or some other reason, it's never the same. Continuity, folks, continuity. That's all I want.   The space is great, love the decor especially the light fixtures, and I think they did a wonderful job transforming the space.

t9gsvyGnYhFdiaCPTXHOzw.text: If you thought the NoDa location was cute, this one may be even cuter! I have been here multiple times and always notice something new. Wine is good, coffee is good, food is good. Service great too! Seriously, this place is a MUST!

3f0P54Rp8xJmBqZbf9VjEA.text: Love this place. I can sit at the bar and have a glass of wine which is nice. The ham and Gruyere tartine is so delicious. All in all a great place to stop for a glass of wine and some awesome food.

Y1vjyUfD9iYoIVbo8hnL-A.text: stopped here for lunch. lots of seating and cool decor.  got a sandwich, lavendar + honey iced soda,  and 3 different flavored macarons.  sandwich and the drink were good.   the macarons.. I was extremely disappointed. one was really chewy,  one was hard like a cracker, and one was just sticky. they were all too big and sweet. I can safely say that they were the worst macarons I've ever tasted.   still 3 stars because I dig the vibe and the food/drink was good. just don't get the macarons.

WQUv6T77dzdldutI_fCQ3A.text: When I first walked into this cafe, I was charmed by all the cute, French-inspired decor around the cafe. I loved how there was ample seating in the shop for large groups of people to talk and socialize. They have a wide selection of pastries, as well as regular food.   I got an apple tart and peach tart since they looked really good in the case. I paid around $10 for both tarts, and was unfortunately disappointed by their taste. While the apple tart tasted fine, it was slightly hard and stale. I couldn't even eat 1/3 of the peach tart since the flavor was just off, and it was also hard and stale.  I heard their other dishes and pastries were better, so I probably just had bad luck with the apple and peach tarts. Might be back to try their other items!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apple and peach tart - approx $11 total

Jm54K6I3VNoEVH4lz8qoLA.text: A cute little cafe in Charlotte! We got the chocolate gateau and it was absolutely phenomenal!! Not crazy super sweet and instead a perfect chocolatey consistency. The chocolate eclair we got was also perfect! We also ordered the lavender honey soda which was so interesting. You can definitely taste both flavors and it would be refreshing for a hot summer day. It also wasn't like your typical soda and super sweet, so if you like the normal stuff then this might not be the drink for you. The reason I took a star off was because of the amount of single use plastic the store used! You would think for the prices that they could afford to use real spoons/forks/cups. Everything other than the plate with our baked goods was single use plastic- for our "for here" order. Not a big difference then between eating there and taking out. I hope they can reduce their plastic use in the future. Otherwise, the food was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lavender honey soda
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate gateaux and chocolate eclair

PYkwp7KpsHzAET5aEq-CvQ.text: Don't think twice about the chicken salad sandwich combo meal on one of Amelie's Famous Crescents. This is just the right amount of filling, sweet, and crunchy (apples). Highly recommend this gets into the lunch rotation.   2- pairs well with a soup or salad

66ZUqG9_BuXfuo6wbfh9Yw.text: I heard good things about this spot, but Amelie's did not impress.   I ordered a mimosa with just a splash of juice (as noted on the receipt) and was disappointed that the bartender didn't follow the instructions. My quiche Lorraine was over baked (notice the dark brown/BURNT crust) and dry throughout.   I agree with other reviewers that some staff seemed rude (the food runner).   Will probably not return. I recommend you don't waste your money coming here.

bSuQTYVQeJWYIkFMf1hnxg.text: I had heard people rave about this place for long enough and wanted to try it. The atmosphere is to die for, it's a little whimsical, but still incredibly romantic. Think Paris France and Alice in Wonderland had a love child. This is a great spot for date night! I ordered a cafe creme (latte) and a fruit tart. My wife ordered a key lime pie tart.  All the employees were super polite. The restaurant was spotlessly clean. I didn't feel rushed to make a decision at either the drink counter, or the bakery case, like normal bakeries push you along down the line. We spent a total of $15, and it's was the best $15 I've ever spent. So good, we are craving it just one day later! 100% reccomend! A MUST try if you're in the Charlotte Uptown area!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

xZyauT_8cWBHQO0BBieeSg.text: Unique restaurant with cool collective furniture and decorations similar to those in France. Cashier seemed like he was rushing us to take our order. When asked what type of soups they had he pointed for me to look at the board. When my coworker asked what type of salad comes with his meal, he was also pointed to look at another board. Most servers/cashiers are knowledgeable about their menus and are willing to tell customers what they have available. Service wise, the first time experience could have been much better. As for the food, it was mediocre at best. Nothing to rave about...including the deserts. First time in the city and last time at this restaurant.

WdkR2P-APl6qDPJEXcu30w.text: The best French cafe! A bit like Moulin in Newport Beach, CA. Even though it's hugeness with lots of tables, not easy to find a table at the prime time. We went 3 times while we were in Charlotte, sat twice downstairs, one at the corner of upstairs. For three times ilsa had BLT, ilan his croissant with gruyere cheese and I had ham, tomato and brie with cappuccino. All was super tasty! Great place.

VJsItZBivuU1AnytvD3aKw.text: Amelia's is a great place to have a pick me up coffee or an after dinner dessert. The macaroons are the best I have ever had. When you bite into the dessert, it has a crunchy exterior with a fluffy and light interior. Every day they have a variety of flavors to choose from. I have tried birthday cake, wild berry, salted caramel, chocolate and mocha. Not only do they have macaroons but they also have a variety of pastries, sandwiches and soups. I would definitely recommend trying this establishment! There are two locations one in uptown which closes at 12 and the other location stays open 24 hours.

fXQWhfuptLtMBX97ISFTeQ.text: So great I came here almost every day for my morning routine on my business trip. There's 2 lines, one if you're getting bakery items (then you can order breakfast sandwiches) or just the breakfast sandwiches line.  On days where the bakery line was empty, I just got an item to skip the other line. But let me tell you, sandwiches here were great. Not so heavy but filled with flavour. The pastries? Get out of town. Delicious. Chocolate croissant (twiced baked) was absolutely delicious.  Definitely recommend this spot to try at least once if you are in Uptown.

C5IjaTjOJaDBY-i8bGhz7w.text: After watching The Most Incredible Thing on two different days, a ballet at the Knight Theater, we headed over to Amelie's Cafe both times. The cafe is a couple of blocks away and is easy to walk to.  The first time was after opening night, so it was likely around 22:00 when we arrived. It was busy. I ended up reserving a table for us by plopping our coats and my purse on our three comfy chairs. I didn't do any ordering, but I wanted the iced lavender drink with honey.  Both my friends came back about fifteen minutes later. The lineup was long. An older man with his date joked that he'd come sit with me. I had a snappy comeback which made them both laugh.  They came back with my beverage. They also got the following: - Petit fours, consisting of chocolate mousse, lemon, chocolate strawberry cups, and pistachio - Strawberry rhubarb almond cake - Vanilla strawberry cheesecake  They joined me at the table. We chatted and shared all the decent, scrumptious desserts. Like the first time at this cafe in Rock Hill, everything I had was divine. They weren't overly sweet. They were perfect.  It was during our stay at this cafe that we booked our tickets to the ballet the following afternoon. My friend did the booking and I offered to charge it to my credit card. Ah, teamwork!  After the matinee show on Sunday, we went for a late lunch first, and then decided to hit this cafe again. We thought of having a movie night at the hotel, and indulge in pastries and more together.  I was fortunate to participate in selecting goodies for us. Collectively, we got the following: - Bread pudding - Napoleon - Two key lime tarts - Dark chocolate raspberry tart  I am not a huge fan of the Napoleon to begin with. One of my friends ordered it, which was huge. I ended up being stuck with the remaining piece after they both headed home. I loved everything else. Nothing was left, except the bread pudding. I actually brought it back to Markham and ate it! It had chocolate mixed in, which was so yummy.  This bakery has a cafe in Rock Hill, SC; and another in Atlanta, GA. The remaining locations are in Charlotte, which is another good reason to return for a future visit.  If you are ever in Charlotte, I recommend coming here to either chat, have a cup of coffee, or get dessert to take with you. It's all good no matter what you do.  (137)

3OuPOfCADiRCurOrF3Vdsg.text: I love this local CLT haunt. The inside sort of reminds me of the mad hatters tea party - eclectic furniture all over, interesting chandeliers, and silly photos on the walls. It's a massive space located in uptown CLT.   I enjoy the fresh squeezed orange juice and the croissant BEC sandwich. The bacon is cooked to perfection.   I've toyed with getting the chicken salad before, but I was told that the secret ingredient is powdered sugar so I thought it might be a tad too sweet for me.   It appears that there is an event space above the main level- it would be a perfect venue for a baby/bridal shower!   Love it here!

RHMIQcIDqiNIXU_fEQ62Zg.text: A little Paris in the middle of Charlotte. The coffee is amazing. Makes Panera taste like Maxwell House. Service is great. Such a lovey little gem. When you buy pastry they don't shove it into a bag and say here you go. They put it in a little box to protect it. Ok it's not cheap but it's a treat!

1bqBVCjN768ZxhYGpyH6eg.text: I loved having a nice late evening chat with my friend here. We shared their famous salted caramel brownie and I also had an iced lavender latte. The brownie had the perfect texture and was a delicious dessert, and the lavender latte was exactly what I wanted.   Amelie's has a super cute and interesting ambiance. Pay special attention to their unique collection of chandeliers. You could spend quite some time here just looking around.

6clDK9TJUAHCd6anu6NQbg.text: Amazing pastries. Highly recommend the tarts and salted Carmel brownie. Disgusting filthy bathrooms. I noticed the 95 out of 100 heath code rating. A little low for this type of establishment. 4 stars for cleanliness or lack their of.

pb_0GTM3YjWetxakrHqZSQ.text: Amalie's catering exceeded my expectations with a tremendous spread for our open house lunch.  Generous portions, exceptional quality, taste and visual appeal. You sure made my job easy. Thanks!

hiS8lhRby4rKDdwI2POdPA.text: The perfect stop for late night chocolate cravings after a panthers game! Only about a ten minute walk from the stadium. The interior is fun and eclectic, and the basil blueberry lemonade was delicious. We got a chocolate mousse with chocolate ganache.  Absolute heaven.  Great place to come for a date night or even by yourself to just chill. Love that they also have beer and wine available.    I'd love to come back and try all their desserts next time!

aEBl4erxRy9D74Ao5UWTnQ.text: Great atmosphere, pastries were amazing! Depending on which side of the street you are on, the entrance is a little hard to get to. We were there on a Saturday afternoon and some of the side entrances were closed. We eventually found the front and it was no big deal.

OvoIbD9FtMhU5oPrGcM5Dg.text: Ran in to get a little snack and ended up with 2 palmiers and a mini mixed berry tart.  The young man who helped me was friendly even though the 2 guys in front of me had trouble deciding what they wanted.  They took forever!    I love a good palmier.  Theirs was good and buttery.  The mini tart was also enjoyable.  Just the perfect size for a snack.  I'd like to try a meal there next time.  Cute place.

SCQfBJ6qk1N5O9VrLEYRnA.text: This place is so convenient for working meetings uptown.  Our team loves going here to get out of the office, drink delicious coffee and eat heavenly breakfast sandwiches     I looooove the bacon,egg, cheese, and spinach on a baguette.  It's so delicious and filling.    Plus if you are craving a sweet treat the macaroons do not ever disappoint .    Amelie's also has WiFi and the building is decorated so cute!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

87RW7DHMIsGCZ3gZKJ0OZw.text: A friend really wanted to go here for lunch while we were in town for a conference, and the biggest issue was finding the place.  We ended up going in through an office building, not realizing that the main entrance was around the corner.  I did appreciate the large roped-off area for the lines to order, with bakery and cafe split up, but at prime lunchtime, the cafe line was staffed by one cashier who, while nice, seemed new.  So the line moved veeeery slowly.  We also had some confusion about what to do with the buzzers, since it seemed like we were being told to stack them on some sort of thing on the table -- except that we didn't see anything like that outside.  Overall, very confusing.  I was pleasantly surprised at what seemed like pretty low prices, but as it turns out, the portion sizes are quite small.  My Provence BLT was on a croissant that was crumbling to pieces in my hands (over toasted, maybe) with approximately 2 pieces of bacon on it.  The seasonal truffle and thyme potato salad was decent, but could have used salt (I wasn't about to go look for it...), and all in all, $8 for lunch seemed a bit steep based on what I actually got.  However, the restaurant itself is quite large and very beautiful.  We enjoyed a perfect day to sit outside.  And, most impressively, I happened to be with a genuine Frenchman, who said that the pate was very good and the baguette tasted just like they do in France (rather than our US imitations, apparently).  So while I don't think I would go back for lunch, I have to give Amelie's the benefit of the doubt.  The desserts did look amazing, so maybe someday I'll be able to stop back for a pastry and coffee.

la2oRO61gqEESGww1iGLMw.text: I love the ambiance and decor of this place - and the food is delicious ! I try to eat healthy when I travel so o added salmon to their pear salad - it was sweet, savory and filling! I also tried one of their signature iced cafe drinks which did not disappoint! It looks like I'll be coming here quite often on my trip

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food should be healthy and delicious ! Loved this salad and their signature iced cafe latte!

Mmt8IQezZsdbqbcPsogfyg.text: Eat here twice during my stay. Relaxed environment, lots places to eat. Great food the tartines, salad and sweets all amazing. Staff super friendly and prices reasonable.  Great place to sit eat and watch all the people pass by.

H5DiZG6II9uP-l9yLof6_w.text: The best.  Just go here, it is the best.  My whole review was going to say, "the best.", but yelp wants more characters, so the rest is a filler.  It's the best.

RaYUWXeHGyuvgwBOroStiA.text: They served my baked goods on a plate that had some kind of dirty sticky substance on the bottom of it. My hands were too sticky to get my wallet. I went to their bathroom to wash my hands and there was no soap, which makes me wonder what their employees are using before they bake our food.

PCO7rGvEbl1P8RKWs3dDfQ.text: I decided for once to stay in a different part of Charlotte on this trip in (instead of Trade & Tryon, which has been the epicenter of the recent riots), which gave me the opportunity to pass by Amelie's on the way to my client's office.   Amelie's is a smallish bakery located on a quiet corner in Charlotte, near the Convention Center. There is quite a bit of seating space (2 bars, three different rooms and outdoor space) and a few options to order based on your preference.   In a hurry? Try the separate lines for food / coffee / pastries Riding solo? Post up at the bar tops and get access to everything. PRO TIP: skip the lines by ordering at the bar Hot date? There's tables and couches galore, based on your 'angle'... ;)  While there, you definitely need to get their caramel toffee brownie (they have a gluten free variety too!). Coffee is good as well. I had the egg and cheese sandwich which was light yet filling, and with some hot sauce is really good for breakfast.   All in all, I recommend stopping in Amelie's if you're in Charlotte, at a minimum for the caramel brownies.

EVFsNs81WWX48zeDMrQ8Yw.text: Constantly disappointed with this location... Staff is borderline rude, place is always dirty. Love the fruit tarts in noda, stopped in here to give it another try. Told the lady the ones on the top looked old and that i wanted a fresh one. She said ok no problem, and gave me an OLD ONE(they had fresh on the bottom). the berries were hard, the whole thing was stale. I mentioned it and no one cared at all. $5!!! For a stale pastry!! Bar cocoa down the street or even panera bread is better than this location. Avoid.

T-DoeiyDSjeTMJx4USyzxA.text: Hard to not like anything about this place. Kids love getting "special treats" here and makes for a great family date spot

qOUJLXB98onvnW9PqxvjUg.text: Really delicious pastries. Not only are the yummy, but also so appealing to the eyes! The shop is spacious and I love the pastel colors/delicate wall decor.  But do note, it is really crowded in there- at all times. The line was rather annoying. Also, their bathrooms are THE DIRTIEST. I guess being open 24/7 is the reason. Seriously, urine-all-over-the-floor dirty. Long story short, I had to take my pastries to go.  Regardless of the crowd/lack of cleanliness, I'll have to come back since their pastries are quite possibly the best in NC.

zg0hYXiDGOTuWM_bp72CmQ.text: Best Creme brulee in charlotte! I have tried almost everything at this wonderful place and nothing has ever disappointed.

MpuH_TazBbxXCb6-dtxyNA.text: Wow! The fun (and whacky) atmosphere, the capital K-I.N.D. staff and wine from France (oh yeah and GREAT food) what's not to love! - and OH YES Marie Antoinette on a china cabinet!

acTHyHh8RxEgVHV1v2fuAw.text: Best tarts EVER! We had the pear, apricot mixed fruit and raspberry lemon cream tarts. All extremely delicious.

zE_9NprM2IoALnvVqQVx1g.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte. I love the food, drinks, and atmosphere. Anytime my friends or family come to visit, I always bring them to try it.

9xT2Vo9D8rj7anMshlrlrQ.text: I love this new Amelie's location. They have a good sized bar (with beer and wine) and plenty of seating. If you decide to stay for drinks, our bartender offered to let us skip the line and get our eclair for us (nice!). Which, by the way, was delicious! Everything I saw go by looked so good, it's really hard not to order it all.   I'm glad this part of Uptown is growing and that we have a great option for drinks/dessert! Yes, I'm going back as soon as possible.

xM2-sj6_EZ6ztXePYrm86g.text: This is a 10 Star atmosphere and food establishment. When you walk into the area of the dining room there is Decour that cannot be replicated anywhere else. Multiple lines to get you the type of food you looking to indulged in. :)  The coffee is made the quickest. They call out by name. And with a smile. The food is delivery by wait staff with a smile. The food was absolute amazing taste to the right amount.

axr_Xa2I6Q_7vzrd0aLPrA.text: This sweet bakery is so delicious. Every time I go into the restaurant for a quick coffee or to pick up lunch it's impossible to get out of there without a delicious dessert! I am obsessed with their eclairs and even their tarts! They are truly made like the French tarts I enjoy every time I go to Europe.   I am looking forward to going back for dessert in the near future! It's such a great place to pick up a dessert to accompany any home made dinner not to mention how great the food and coffee is on top of everything else!

KpWVSMajh0Y9ITuP41_Vzw.text: This rating is based on the food. I ordered a piece of their whole cake which has strawberry filling. My cake was INCREDIBLY dry. $4.50 wasted. The frosting was in a clunk, I poked it to try and it just fell straight off the cake. Seriously for this price, I was expecting much more. I am not sure if all cakes made at Amelie are this dry, because my friend said she tried a piece of the strawberry round cake and it was also very dry.  The blueberry and lavender cold drink was good, but it was just crushed blueberry with sugared water. $3. Free wifi here, a lot of space and the upper floor can be rented out for an event. Outdoor seating.

zeJTMl82qv2KScfoIFqSOw.text: Some of the best breakfast I have ever had! What I love is that it is a great atmosphere- super French bakery but not stuffy. The food menu is simple but with a great variety. More impressive is the sweets case! Gorgeous and delicious! Chocolate eclairs are to die for and the cappuccino is amazing. Service was super friendly and the guy behind the counter was very helpful in aiding me to make up my mind what to get. Don't miss this dog- friendly spot with wonderful baked goods. Coming back for that bread pudding!!!

aB5y2hUGTVLzV1sLOi5Ifw.text: I love the NODa location but a larger space was definitely needed a larger space and so happy they decided to put one uptown!  The layout of this one is brilliant, you can see the pastries and baked good while waiting in line so you see and think about what you want before you're up to order. There's a second separate line for just ordering coffee and non bakery items.  The food and coffee are excellent. If you're new to Amelie's I recommend (like everybody else) the salted caramel brownie and the macaroons.  There's a reason everybody says that, they're delicious!  I've also had the quiche and loved it.  I'm sipping on an iced salted caramel coffee and loving that as well.  Now make this location 24 hrs and I'll give it 6 stars.

cVxLfLsPHQUHMPqz2StDLw.text: Well to start out this magically bakery is opened 24/7 to serve all of the hungry people of Noda and most of Charlottes early risers. We arrived here after picking my mom from the airport about a 20 min drive depending on traffic and stop lights. Once we got inside we ordered the famous Carmel brownies,macaroons, almond tea cakes, and several other beautifully crafted petite fours to eat and take with us on the journey back home today. As for the food I ordered the delightful croque massieur forgive me if I spelled that wrong but it's basically a croissant w ham and cheese that's my way of explaining the simplified version of the dish. Very very good make sure you try it as soon as possible. But getting back to the bakery, after ordering are dishes we sat in the back at a large table just enjoying the decor anticipating a great breakfast. We all loved what we had to eat and can't wait to return !

rlFFcq4obs_QPymvE2Lgeg.text: The only downside is the long wait but maybe that's because a convention was in town. Oh god the bakery...get the salted caramel brownie! And the s'mores macaroon and the petite four. Ask the staff for their recommendations, they know what's great! And definitely get the lavender lemonade. Russian tea was also excellent.

3_IK4WRjssVRZZhBEltynw.text: Love the space and the food. My only comment is that employees shouldn't eat in view of customers. A BIG no no. A worker was chomping down pastries from behind the bakery counter. While five people stood in line to pay, watching her. Very off putting.

jQPaKS2EPKiOcli9Hg6j0g.text: Perfect breakfast sandwiches - get them on a baguette! I also split the macarons with my friend - pistachio was my favorite, and the pumpkin macaron was excellent. The food is excellently prepared, the service is great, and the atmosphere is tres French. Lots of seating. Even if there's a long line, it moves pretty fast.

RVITKwKjspekQtYONPCZRg.text: I've been here many times and my order is wrong frequently. Today's mistake, ordered a seasonal salad add goat cheese (it was on one of the other 3 seasonal salads) add chicken. Number gets called and the dressing it comes with is not available. No biggie. I get my order and get back to work to realize there was no goat cheese. I walk back and was told they were out of it-I got charged. The cashier was happy to remedy it but with only 30 mins for lunch, no thanks. Get back to finally sit down and I realize no pecans on the salad as advertised. 6 things were supposed to be on the salad 3 showed up. Not great. Won't be back anytime soon.

EuGPzBIoQOg6TkiqX_7Jaw.text: My 10 year old daughter gives Amelie 5 stars. She had the Blueberry Muffin and said it was fabulous. I had the quiche and an Americano. The coffee was great and the food is good. We will be back for some macaroons before the weekend is over.

uoHXgxFOWgGsyKWeguOiIw.text: Cool little French restaurant.  Nice decor.  The breakfast sandwiches are really good, and the coffee (latte) was delish as well.  Great place to visit in downtown Charlotte.

YVBceyJ-d6EfKnz2RK_oEw.text: Yummy place with great vibe and great food. It was so close to my hotel that I ate there twice while I was visiting Charlotte.

74t1IIEa89ulyZfEPVSioA.text: Perfect French desserts with a cute atmosphere and great places to sit. Eclectic with great food and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lavander, salted caramel, and lemon rose.

xpnQOZXusAOwR_Tj5zTYRw.text: Love their coffee and the desserts. I would definitely recommend salted caramel, pecan tart and the Napoleon! My friend liked the macaroons too- they have varied flavors. And the best thing they are open late.

gEhknJJoQZzTegPe_iPstQ.text: This place was so awesome. The first thing I noticed was the eccentric decor. My food and coffee were delicious and came out very quickly. Lots of seating available. I would definitely recommend this place for breakfast and I would absolutely come back here!!

eWMsXq0PYuH1OWzNMxqkog.text: This is a wonderful bakery/coffee shop with a comfortable  vibe. The pastries are excellent - especially their flaky croissants and their sublime pecan rolls. Friendly staff , plenty of parking - this place is terrific.

3R6OuKyBqwclyLmKiZit0w.text: Think Panera Bread with a larger more interesting environment and some additional selections you'll have a good idea of what to expect here.  Some menu items, such as the soup and quiche varieties, change daily.  There is a fairly large selection of pastries.  Overall if you enjoy Panera, you're probably not going to be disappointed here either.

fhDpbSNkQ3b_1s0IKe902g.text: I probably should have known better than to order a salad, but it was awful. They up sold me on chicken, which had a boiled consistency and made me gag. Tea cup was hardly full. Not too wowed by the uptown location in terms of food or service. Stay safe and grab a salted caramel brownie.

KO1gcNsQZpuTefVp5xOfsg.text: Amazing pastries and soups.  Worth stopping by both locations, Uptown and NoDa.

KIOhbGUnvWFS2cWbHkhZTQ.text: This is a relatively new restaurant bakery that's been reopened from a previous location downtown.  Great atmosphere and great menu.  Ham and cheddar quiche was barely warm but cream puff was very good.  Service was slow but very pleasant.  So why am I giving it five stars?  Because it's not IHOP, Burger King, Wendy's, or another boring fast food chain restaurant.  It's a great local spot and a refreshing alternative to something other than a fast food place that you can find anywhere.  BTW, the pastries and breads are outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot tea, ham and cheddar quiche and creampuff.

_E1lNx_UMP93KUPj2kqtJQ.text: Everything that we ordered was amazing. We gad chocolate mousse, cream puff and quiche. Delicious! U can also see the making of their desserts. The inside is beautiful and makes u feel like u r in Paris!  Great experience.

_YvE_kN-LgmfGm9v2LP-IA.text: I'm sorry.  But, Amelie's is kind of overrated.  That being said, I'm giving this one four-stars because the wifi actually works consistently at this location.  If you're from out-of-town, you'll probably like it.  (The vast selection is, admittedly, cool.)

UZf50YJBBydBLDlnncXXHA.text: I really wanted this place to be good. We waited in line for 30 minutes bracing for the celebrated Amelie's cafe. When it was my turn to order the cashier abruptly told us that they were out of food but we were welcomed to order the few pastries that were left. The service was horrid and the pastries stale. The coffee was good, which is why I give it two stars. Would not recommend you go there.

NvGUwi1qtsYPlRtE-9_ZYg.text: The pros are that they have made an uptown space unique and comfortable.  But the service was so poor, my husband and I were laughing out loud at how unhelpful the employees were.  Multiple lines for ordering and paying were confusing and resulted in me having to get back in line when our muffin wasn't brought to the table with the rest of our food.  My egg sandwich and coffee got cold at my table while I waited in line watching the painfully slow bakery counter clerk fumble expensive pastries into boxes.   Three cashiers with no one in their line stood around watching the bakery line grow.  Finally a cashier gave in and put on some gloves to help out.  The batter in the muffin that caused the confusion had pockets of unmixed ingredients.  The good news is, good management could improve things, but the employees need to step it up, realizing that they are there to help unfamiliar guests.

8UgVpd0IePEbZO_elZvfNg.text: I went here for brunch and had the make your own breakfast sandwich. The food was great!!!!! The atmosphere is even better!!!!

2D4iSnbuPnqsKEC1nHLw2w.text: Love love love this place. I am on a strict diet but that doesn't mean I cannot enjoy the smells!!!!! Awesome. Nice friendly staff. Very clean and a great location!!! Love the Noda area!!

xOi8snjpaNpERBYvxqizZQ.text: The pastries and desserts (especially the macaroons and salted Carmel brownies) are incredible.  The atmosphere is really the stand out as it provides uptown with a real "hangout" spot. It's such a good chill environment and the kind of change uptown needs.  If there's any complaints it's that the lines take forever and the beer selection needs to be better and include local.

jFW_6_psRMJbWEMAlI9WFg.text: Great Coffee House/Bistro/Bakery - Here in town on business and I had 2 meals here. Everything was fresh and tasty. Turkey & Brie on a baguette was great. The fruit compote really brought out the flavors. I did have a salted caramel brownie for dessert and it was sweet and delicious as promised.   The next meal was the Mushroom & Chevre' Crepe. It was very filling and again very fresh. The macaroons were gigantic and tasty.   The staff was courteous, smiled and were all very helpful. It has become my hangout place in Charlotte.  I will be back next time in town

ZI5eg1ubb6W_LuCy-cbAVw.text: I was charged $8 for a bacon, egg white, Brie croissant! That's way more than the same thing at the Noda location.  And it was a hot, sloppy mess of a sandwich.  I'll be sticking to the Noda locations in the future and suggest the same for everyone.  So sad, because the location & decorations are beautiful.

myRP4Q_iW1quOxOFYF87rQ.text: Such a unique little cafe (it's actually quite spacious) with a choice of counter seating, or if you prefer a cozy sofa to curl up in front of a faux fireplace, or perhaps you like a more face to face encounter, then take your seats at a cafe table and sit in a pair of lucite chairs...wherever you choose to sit, amaze yourself with all the lovely and quirky decor, from crystal chandeliers to funky Mona Lisa paintings, mini Eiffel Tower models, an upside tree growing from the ceiling, and so much more...it's totally a date spot...hangout, and they even have a private party area on the upper level...the sweet delicacies taste amazing and the coffees are just as wonderful...the service is also just as fabulous!  We only come down to Charlotte on business 2x a year, but this newly opened establishment will definitely be on our to do list for every future trip...You must stop in, it's like an art gallery you can sit and eat in, and just relax and enjoy the amazing atmosphere that Amelie's has created...

Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chandeliers
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

xgKLMJIPl2lp3XaFJLscLg.text: This is the strongest 5 stars I can possibly give.  I come here occasionally with my wife and four year old son to relax and enjoy some much needed time with the family. Their service is amazing. Such a chill, friendly, and positive environment. Tonight  the cashier sparked conversation since there wasn't anyone waiting in line and in the middle of conversation i noticed I had left my wallet home. Embarrassed, I apologized and asked to suspend my order...he picked up my tab with a smile and my family and I enjoyed our night. So thankful for this place.

MN5iwm_exluKTpQiqaeOpw.text: As a native of CLT, I can say I've visited multiple Amelie's locations, probably more than I'd care to admit & recommended it to many people over the years. I was ecstatic when they opened right across from my work in Uptown. Unfortunately, I have to say the quality of food & customer service at the this location has significantly declined. This morning was the fourth time in a row I was disappointed. My breakfast sandwich had the bare minimum of ingredients (so little cheese I actually had to check after a few bites) & also cold- it was not busy so not sure why. The other times I've visited lately, the sandwiches I had were subpar at best, one even had bacon that was pretty burnt- had to pick it off to eat. As far as customer service, the baristas are on their own time. After waiting 25 minutes the other night for a quick coffee, I had them change my order to tea & just ate the price difference, so I could just get a hot drink & go, as I had somewhere to be & couldn't continue to wait around. Perhaps they should focus on their job instead of chatting with other employees. This is not the quality I'm used to from Amelie's nor worth the price, which I hate to say. Amelie's, I'll always visit for your sweets but please work on maintaining the high quality of food & service that we've come to expect instead of expanding into new locations!

w_Ss0jFQhlRqvz_poBRFEg.text: There is no other place like Amelie's. Desserts are all fantastic and the savory food is great too! I just wish they had more milk options for drinks - they only have whole milk and almond milk, both of which are a little heavy for me. But still an awesome spot!

xFpnR7hsfunqa868A5m2QA.text: I love the pastries and coffee and the atmosphere but I have to say the SERVICE is TERRIBLE!!!  Cashiers and coffee makers stand there & chat with each other when customers are standing waiting! Or out if 3 cashier counters only 1 is working! They take their sweet time making coffee too! This is NOT a service oriented business. The management needs to do a better job of training their stuff to do their job in Timely and Friendly manner instead of treating customers as if doing them a favor!   You guys are surrounded by bankers who don't have a lot of time to stand around & waiting till the staff finish their chit chat!

AaIAspP2upgjRC65nzZupw.text: Great location and menu. Gives a sense that you are dining in a French Bistro. Menu options include brunch items and a wide variety of pastries and cookies. I have tried the salted caramel brownies and the key lime tarts. The key lim tarts are my favorite as the custard is light and the lime flavor is very well balanced. They are open into the late evening. So a great option for after dinner dessert.

cBVISeFhk2ugOFe1-rPjEA.text: Looked cute and we were only needing a small bite to eat since it was late in that afternoon. Staff is rude and act like your an inconvenience. Food was ok but staff is the reason I won't come back

mXMz6vFEEM1wCeXiJO0E1w.text: I come here every so often just to see maybe the pastries or coffee has gotten better. I tried a caramel sea salt latte (something like that) and it tasted like it was burnt. There was a long line there and I didn't have time to wait to get my latte remade. Today I tried another drink, the barista didn't say hi or even smile. It seemed like it was a huge inconvenience to him to make me the blackberry iced drink. I don't think I will be returning. I am really dissapointed in this place.

xOX823U7DMYksGFPs3Xkig.text: The Pistachio macarons are amazing!  The atmosphere and the people are very welcoming. I love stopping by every time I'm in town.

jGkgAah-34-XDHh--xbsvw.text: I got a take out coffee -- sipped it and it was so burning hot I reflexively spat it out on the counter. The barista saw and heard me exclaim how hot it was, but just left me, embarrassed, to clean up. Two hours later and my tongue still hurts and is bleeding in one small place. If you insist on making take out coffee hot enough to scald with even a tiny sip please don't fill the cups to overflowing and do warn the customer to give it 5-10 mins. Meanwhile the Napolean I got at the same time was frozen on the middle.

j1onZkxY5Gr3L5Eh6doP4w.text: I have been here several times. Macaroons are to die for!! Should have gotten some to go! The line can be really long on Friday and Sat nights but it moves fairly quickly, so don't let it detour you. Lots of seating because the place is massive. Think old warehouse decorated into French Cafe.   Food is fresh and always delicious! Service is good with a smile!

3XbXUtn147X8grHN81g96A.text: I visited Charlotte recently and quickly became obsessed with the breakfast sandwiches at Amelie's.

glFWgYlV-34Vn_3TxhKELA.text: What a fun spot!  We are in Charlotte for a family function and found this spot while wandering around the city.  The food, coffee, staff, and vibe here are wonderful.  I wish we were going to be in town longer, as this would be a daily spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Macaroons anyone?

Tfvm4r3ug-SDCeAQoSsksg.text: Such a fun and unique atmosphere! Love the food too, a must try. Great to go to whether it's just you and a couple girlfriends for brunch, or hang out and get some work or studying done with fresh tasty coffee. There's some really cute themed trinkets to buy here too.

Qi20zNnmXVTywsqcW8lEVQ.text: A lovely respite in uptown. Love the decor - so peppy and uplifting but then if you put me in front of that much sweet stuff I will feel happy any ways. Love their macaroons but love their cappuccino even more. One of the rare places in Uptown with decent coffee. I've had breakfast here and it's decent but nothing amazing and they lose one star in that but overall I still like the place. I'll definitely be going back

VMTvrvnnGc7Ro504-a6cMA.text: Great option for a quick and inexpensive lunch when you're working uptown in Charlotte.   Daily lunch specials are always the best or you can create your own deli-style sandwich. My fav is their  toasted BLT  Sweets galore too if you just have to have a sugar fix!

olN2kz0S6Ii4v8XJjkhguQ.text: The coffee here is splendid, it's aroma is so captivating. My son ordered the black coffee, which was surprisingly good considering that I don't like my coffee strong. This is a great place to hang out with my kids and my girlfriends. The location here is amazing because as soon as you finish your coffee, you get to stroll through downtown and explore. The thing that I love most about this place is their chandeliers, hands down breath taking.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

pJMCbRiXVec8GveeMlu5qQ.text: This place is great for satisfying that sweet craving you have! There are numerous items on the list and I'm sure you won't be disappointed. I am a HUGE sweets addict and I'm always very pleased when I come. Of course there is always coffee on the menu for all of you coffee lovers!

E9_CMe66M2LxxoV4ORBC0w.text: When i think French bakery i think Pain au chocolat! I went to Amelie's ready to order it and was told they had none. Mind you this was at 11 am on Easter so you would think better planning would have taken place!! At the register i was told that the bakers only made one tray of pain au chocolat that morning!! How ridiculous!! I'm visiting Charlotte so this was my one chance to experience Amelie's French pastries! Disappointed customer to say the least!!

CqnMQLlJrSeUcJobCsBsIQ.text: If I could come here every day for the rest of my life, I think I would. If I could live in this restaurant, I think I would. If that puts anything into perspective.   We came here for a sweet bite after dinner. First, walking in you are just taken aback by the decor. This place is HUGE and full of unique lights, artwork, and seating. There are different rooms and levels to sit in, each with cool aesthetics. We ordered macrons and their infamous salted caramel brownie. They have so many different flavors of macrons, and the ones we chose were all so friggin tasty. The brownie was very delicious as well.   They also have a wine and beer bar, which would be fun to come back to and try out. They also serve food! Seriously, they have everything you could ever need in this place. Love, love, LOVE.

Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

XB0L0E_ECTCqHk9EO1gTpA.text: Hazelnut praline coffee, espresso gateau and salted carsmel brownie! Really like the salted caramel brownie! The espresso cake is good but would be better if there is less cream. Pretty good service and casual environment to do work and hang out!

A74XcE6_23ewuaqDGJmgHg.text: This has become a family favorite, just down the street from us. Yummy food, the best coffee drinks and the decor is so cool! We end up just hanging around for a good while and feel very welcome to do so. We go the one at Park Road Shopping Center in the back lot. So happy that they came to our area!

GvIRpuIiaNQDL-UqsvcdiA.text: Love this place! The decor is so unique and cute. The service is great. The best part of this coffee shop are the macaroons - raspberry and pistachio are the best! If in Charlotte, I highly recommend Amelie's!

RtNGGbqerCip_zBSvaoyzg.text: Elegant looking coffee place..they have a awesome collection of pastries and other foods. Their mocha is to die for. Love this place. Can't wait to go back.

NONWBezpmQlF7lKsCO1uBw.text: Great spot very enjoyable ambience is a little interesting but the food is delicious sandwiches are delicious desserts were delicious and I had the best cup of coffee I've ever had there sorry babe

RqDPiXBAMbBcAZbVx_AV9w.text: My girlfriend and I went here twice in a row. The coffee was absolutely perfect and the scenery is really cool. If you are looking for breakfast try the egg, sausage and cheese on a croissant. Flakey, buttery and just the right amount of egg.  Update: Went again and everything was perfect. From the cappuccino to the croissant.

4jrTKCSNLpr-KY-qx389JA.text: Absolutely fantastic place for desserts/breakfast. You can pretty much find any pastry here that your little heart desires: cream puffs, palmiers, cake, fruit tarts, etc. Or a delicious, fluffy ham and cheddar quiche slice (or in my case, a little of everything).

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche, breakfast pastries, tea, champagne

2dPFDNXCbPko1imq0R0dbQ.text: I could splurge on Amelie's just about any day of the week. NOM to the max. I went to the Uptown location for the second time last week. I love the Uptown location because it's larger and the line looks less out-of-control because of the way they have it roped off and organized. I always go for the macaroons and salted caramel brownie - my favorite macaroon is the cinnamon chocolate.   My only complaint is that the line here seems to move really slow. Both times I visited the Uptown location, I moved in a really slow line. The NoDa location is often busier and the line moves faster there.

rL-FZLj3Og0IdwPmleL4fQ.text: After all the Amelie's hype I've heard, I was a little disappointed when I finally visited. We wanted to pick up some of the infamous salted caramel brownies for family members we were going to visit and needing to eat breakfast too, decided to kill two birds with one stone.   They do have a very nice patio area Uptown and the inside is decorated very cool. However, I was not impressed with our breakfast. I got the quiche of the day (ham and cheddar) and a cup of the soup of the day (spinach, asparagus and leek). The quiche was not very warm and I couldn't really taste any ham or cheese and the soup was a milk/butter broth with 3 spinach leaves and one carrot floating in it. Boyfriend got the croque monsieur-- which was very tasty-- just not a lot for a $9 sandwich. His summer stew soup was just mediocre as well and none of our meal was very warm.   The salted caramel brownies though.. those are good. We got two of the salted caramel mochas and a creme brulee french soda as well. The soda was delicious and interesting! Must try!   I guess people mainly come for the dessert and coffee-- which is what I will be doing from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

cMuQOVHFVEQcQ1w3NWHI0g.text: This is delicious little lunch spot. Only it's not little--- it's big with lots of seating and lots of fun and funky decor. Seriously, the decor is out of this world amazing. You could spend hours exploring every corner of this place, finding delight in the details.   The ordering process was a little confusing, as there are separate lines depending on what you want to order. I waited in line for close to 20 minutes and I wish that there was a better system in place. I got a half of a chicken salad croissant with a cup of asparagus and leek soup. Heavenly, I tell you. My mouth rejoiced. I also sampled some French Macarons and they were as good as good can be.

4KmOG-8mITi1VXXC6sZYdQ.text: This is my favorite place for breakfast!  The croissants are crunchy air.  Any pastry you get is outstanding.

wDouRlT4Bo9QU7ZWAC9gtA.text: WOW! A coworker brought me to this place so we could do some strategic planning over breakfast and I was so enamored with it that I could hardly focus. The place is so stinkin' cute! The decor is inviting and quite charming. Lots to look at! The food is very good and the people...oh the people! They were so friendly and helpful! This is the kind of place that you just want to bring your money back to time and time again!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome decor

mfo7HWsiy0SARpNr611DhQ.text: We came here for my daughter's birthday, be sure to ask for your birthday eclair. Everyone we interacted with was so super nice which was nice bc it was our first visit. The food was AMAZING.  I had the Lavender soda and my daughter had the creme brulee soda and both were fantastic. Of course the eclair, macaroons, and fruit tart was delicious. The atmosphere was so cozy and eclectic. We just sat in our comfy chairs and hung out till our show started.

a_xdQSn0F-AmKd-65mX2Wg.text: This is such a cute bakery! Clean, lots of seating, and a very fun vibe, yet still a good study spot. The WiFi was strong. Coffee was great (I got an iced dirty chai). Food was amazing! Highly recommend.

vPZLcsMPd6f8Q82hdkaBEQ.text: We really enjoyed our visit. We don't live in the area but when we are in town we like to visit. Good selection of coffees, pastries and deserts. I highly recommend it.

jaLU2Wj_QgjKLTrJvwshvQ.text: This place is really kitschy cute. It's pretty spacious with lots of seating and natural light. The dessert case is very tempting, yet I avoided it so I can't really review any of the treats, but the macaroons are beautiful and looled fresh. You can see the pastry chefs whipping the work in the back. I ordered a turkey and brie sandwich served on a baguette with raspberry compote, and added bacon. The bread was very crusty, the bacon. I went back for extra compote on the side, which tasted great. The restaurant is in a great corner location, but you have to either park on the street or in the parking garage in the back. We got a perfect spot on the street directly out front, and rode scooters up and down the block after lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Upside down trees hanging from the ceiling.

44p59aRb7D2Y02AjSqYV5A.text: Excellent bakery in uptown Charlotte. Large space with plenty of seating inside or outside in the park. Palmer cookie probably the flakiest I've ever had. Almond tea cakes was moist and you tasted the almond flour. Key lime tart was refreshing with a great Friday that was think but not dry and crumbled nicely in your mouth. Only miss was the caramel brownie but overall a great place to stop by for a snack

JToW26v1p00FXZN3583L-A.text: What a cute little bakery in downtown Charlotte! It definitely feels quite different from its surroundings, and the food is excellent.   I had the make-your-own breakfast sandwich, paired with coffee. But they also have a bunch of yummy-looking pastries, and espresso drinks that my family liked.   Everything was reasonably priced, too, which was nice in an area where things were a little pricier. I'd go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast sandwich

w7ffWDCBdQveIXXCVEk6kQ.text: Very good bakery. The coffee beans have awesome flavor. I liked the peach croissant and the key lime pie. Very nice decoration, clean, big place, French environment, interesting place, parking on the street.

MLNQWZUz2DQonlfHJkA4HQ.text: I have walked by this place and been wanting to try it for a while. When you walk in the first thing you notice is how large the space is. There are multiple levels of seating but it was pretty empty when I went so we just found a table close to the bakery window. After checking out the 2 large dessert displays I settled on an eclair and a napoleon. Both were good but the cream in the Napoleon appeared to be partially frozen. Not sure if this is from the temperature in the display case or if they freeze their desserts hence the lost star. They also have a full menu if you are looking for something to eat outside of desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Napoleon and Eclair

htD38fk2NSVwSRM5McrA9A.text: Omgosh- so cute and so tasty!! The hotel concierge suggested this place to us for brunch, as it was just across the street, before heading to the Panthers game and he did NOT disappoint!! This place was great!  The croissant breakfast sandwich was perfect: flaky and buttery, eggs cooked perfectly, bacon sliced thick with a great balance of chew and crunch.  The blackberry tart was outstanding: the dough flaky, the perfect balance of blackberry, meringue,  lemon... really great. What was the most surprising were the macaroons.... they were just... well... average... and for a French Bakery we were expecting the best... sadly, they were not.... but everything else made up for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast sandwich (deconstructed) Delicious!

2fnn-YIclZyKc7EL-FARtg.text: Just get their macaroons !  You will not regret it. I was in town for a conference and looked up charlotte must try cafes and this bakery showed up. Boy i was glad i tried.  It was 90 degrees scorching heat so i sat indoors which was tastefully done. I ordered a browny and a cookie dough macaroons. Browny was good but macaroon was so out of world like i will literally make a trip to North Carolina to have it again!  Perfect place for catching up with girl friends, casual 'first - third' date or just pick me up because the #GOTFinale sucked

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. cookie dough macaroons and brownie!

cYaBYfmDl0SCgqcyaG0zDg.text: Visited yet again after almost 5 months. Must say I missed the ambience ,the cafe mocha and everything about this place.The service is fast and even if you have to wait you can enjoy every moment there just relaxing, viewing the art collection etc. Love coming here anytime.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

VfC5iRQsc6WJRevLSXzjpA.text: Always a good spot to sit and catchup with a friend and to grab a decadent bit. I opted for the soup of the day which was crab and corn chowder, I scored with this pick. It was so good and came with a nice price of a crusty baguette. Only willpower kept me out of the pastry case but I know it's all good (lots of previous visits). I highly recommend the spritz lemonades, they are so refreshing and light.   The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is b/c of the bathroom location. It's concerning that's near doors that lead into the establishment and so far away from staff or ppl period.

zOB_tTZHE-tt4DFLgxeMUQ.text: REALLY REALLY CUTE  I was surprised lots of seating and just as cute as Davidson location with even more selection. Came in mid day and service was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Desserts

BgGds0xm93ONUYpqW6FmJA.text: Despite the food and coffee, I like this place. Sometimes your priority isn't sitting down for a gourmet meal or having an out-of-this-world pastry. Sometimes you just want to be in a warm, inviting, slightly kooky space with great Wifi. It really seems like this is a lovely local spot that people love to hang out in. Is it French food? No. Is it great coffee? No. To be fair, I didn't try the pastries whereas everyone around me seemed to be focusing on that. It's a lovely spot to relax in though.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tartine
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wall

IHtk6GMFDjdfbrfP9NCPmA.text: This Amelie's location is just as amazing as the rest! The only downfall is that every time I've been to this location it is packed! But it's the best bakery around so it's worth the wait.   This past weekend I got the salted caramel brownie, which you need to try if you're coming in for the first time. They have literally sold millions of these brownies that's how good they are! I also got a maple bacon macaroon. It wasn't as good as some of their other macaroon flavors I've had, but it was still pretty good.  Despite always being crowded, you can almost always find a spot to sit. The staff is always friendly and is more than happy to talk you through every single menu and baked good option if you asked them. The prices are a little high, but you can taste the quality and care they put into everything on their menu so it's worth it.

Vd_XsNLnITbRMxFLk1iy_Q.text: Always a must-visit during trips to Charlotte, I'm probably the only person I know who actually prefers the Uptown location of Amelie's over their original in NoDa. Truthfully it's just because the space is a bit bigger and the ordering process isn't so cluttered and squished, but no matter which location you choose you'll be happy you stopped by!   Amelie's food and drink menu is pretty huge, featuring a large array of sandwiches, salads, soups and an entire MASSIVE cabinet of sweets. While coming in for lunch is the obvious choice to try a bit of everything Amelie's is also perfect for a quaint afternoon tea (which is one of my favorite things to do when I'm in town). For less than $10 you can get a pot of tea for two, all the accompaniments as well as a few small sweets to satisfy your craving. I also really enjoy their coffee drinks and the few specialty lemonades i've had (lavender-honey lemonade is a brilliant combo)!   Service at both locations has always been very good, with the people behind the counters happy to answer any questions we have about the menu. I will say I feel like the Uptown location is a bit quicker, as the process as a whole seems a bit more streamlined and organized to get people who have to get back to work in and out quickly.   If you haven't experienced the magic which is Amelie's there's nothing else to say but GO NOW. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Key lime tart, macaroons and tea

J99Ix2lSQWqE14rKwpxLGA.text: The pastries are Devine, the cheesecake here is better than Jr's in NYC, try it, I'm not kidding!  The sandwiches are fresh and big, the soup is delicious and comforting. I've eaten here several times this week while in town on business and will definitely return. Today's location is across from the convention center and the line has been out the door since 8 am, yet here we are at 1 Pm and the entire team is still smiling and hustling! The line moves fast, the food is served hot and the coffee is great.   The decor is a fresh take on a Parisian coffee house, each location is slightly different but follows the same theme.   Do not miss this place, and be sure to thank your server for caring so much about keeping the food and coffee coming. Great job team! Thank you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great decor, and the place is hopping during convention season, but the staff is still friendly and fast!

j10oP_RQnrucFVRpP5YLxw.text: As soon as you step into Amelie's bakery you feel like you're in another world! It is uniquely decorated. When you come in you are greeted by the amazing smell of pastries and soft classic music in the background. This spot is located in the heart of the city making it very convenient. I tried the fresh fruit tart with kiwi and strawberries which honestly wasn't my favorite. I then tried the creeme brulee that was torched to perfection, it's a must have! I ended with a wild berry and chai tea macaroons! Which tasted like heaven. A cozy quiet bakery, that makes you want to do homework or even start reading a book.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main entrance
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States

9cduWTjgq6sHEv0dcQnsAA.text: Magnificent food in a wonderful atmosphere! I love the breakfast sandwich with egg, manchego cheese on a croissant. I love the flavors! They also have phenomenal macaroons--truly like the French ones in Paris!!  I enjoyed the macaroons in the chocolate and cinnamon flavor, the salted caramel brownie flavor, the chocolate and the raspberry flavors.  The salted caramel brownies are a True phenomenal dessert!  They have wonderful coffee and tea options--the Herbal tea with lavender and chamomile is excellent hot or iced. I also love their mochas when I want caffeine with almond milk.   For this location you have to park uptown, I parked in a parking deck and walked to Amelie's.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast sandwich egg, manchego, croissant=yum!

S1aBFuPfaQ12Ti8-3r1ITw.text: The interior deco was impressive . Long line on a Saturday morning during the MLK parade a block away . No big deal since the line moved fast . Ordered large French press dark roast - that was a great pick me up and wake me up now coffee .  We ordered the breakfast sandwich - sausage with Asiago croissant and bacon, portabella mushroom , manchego cheese , and greens in a baguette ( coz I needed a heavier bread ).  The total was $22.23( with tax), great price for an amazing meal . Was tempted to order macaroons but no sweets this morning . Definitely recommended to have a brunch or quick snack in this place . Located in a nice area in City Ctr Charlotte NC.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice interior deco
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order line was long but moved fast

CtidVsUr8SUJNqMQLW7hIg.text: I tried their salted caramel brownie, which was the best brownie I've ever had. I'm not exaggerating. So rich in flavor!!! My friends tried their soups and salad, as well as their macaroons. I went back later to get a breakfast sandwich from their: croissant, bacon, egg, Parmesan, and spinach. $7 is a great price for a breakfast sandwich, which was also delicious and packed with ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Amélie's French Bakery & Café - Charlotte, NC, United States
